item.title: Peperomia Obtusifolia
item.dc:creator: zakhar
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column width="1/2"][woodmart_title align="left" size="large" woodmart_css_id="645ca6c780353" title="Plants" css=".vc_custom_1683793612552{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDVjYTZjNzgwMzUzIiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfdGl0bGUiLCJkYXRhIjp7InRhYmxldCI6e30sIm1vYmlsZSI6e319fQ=="][woodmart_text_block woodmart_css_id="645a0c04b3240" woodmart_inline="no" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDVhMGMwNGIzMjQwIiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfdGV4dF9ibG9jayIsImRhdGEiOnsidGFibGV0Ijp7fSwibW9iaWxlIjp7fX19" parallax_scroll="no" wd_hide_on_desktop="no" wd_hide_on_tablet="no" wd_hide_on_mobile="no"]Croton, also called “garden croton,” are native to the tropical forests of southeast Asia and Oceania. In the wild, they grow as large shrubs, reaching up to 10 feet tall (in the home or garden, they stay a lot smaller). Croton petra plants are susceptible to the bacterial diseases crown gall and xanthomonas leaf spot, and the fungal diseases anthracnose and stem gall and canker. Both crown gall and stem gall and canker present with swelling on the plant's stems, leaf veins and roots and require the pruning of all infected parts in order to be controlled. Xanthomonas leaf spot is identified through the dark brown and black lesions that appear on the leaves. A copper containing bactericide can be used preventatively, but once the plant is infected, it will need to be eliminated. If your plant has anthracnose, you'll notice water spots that turn tan and sometimes have black dots in the center. Note: All parts of this plant are poisonous—especially the seeds—so it is not recommended for use in homes with curious pets or children. When damaged, croton produce a milky sap that can be irritating to the skin, too.[/woodmart_text_block][woodmart_info_box image="235" rounding_size="" image_alignment="left" title_size="large" btn_position="static" btn_color="primary" btn_style="link" woodmart_css_id="6489b6e44b1b4" img_size="103x110" title="Visit the plant care library" btn_text="Care library" svg_animation="no" info_box_inline="no" css=".vc_custom_1686746891645{padding-top: 40px !important;padding-right: 40px !important;padding-bottom: 40px !important;padding-left: 40px !important;background-color: #f6f3ed !important;}" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDg5YjZlNDRiMWI0Iiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfaW5mb19ib3giLCJkYXRhIjp7InRhYmxldCI6e30sIm1vYmlsZSI6e319fQ==" wd_z_index="no" wd_hide_on_desktop="no" wd_hide_on_tablet="no" wd_hide_on_mobile="no" link="url:https%3A%2F%2Fwoodmart.xtemos.com%2Fplants%2Fcare-library%2F|title:Care%20library" woodmart_empty_space=""]Here you will find many useful tips for caring your plants.[/woodmart_info_box][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][woodmart_text_block woodmart_css_id="645a0911b9771" woodmart_inline="no" css=".vc_custom_1683622189660{margin-bottom: 10px !important;}" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDVhMDkxMWI5NzcxIiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfdGV4dF9ibG9jayIsImRhdGEiOnsidGFibGV0Ijp7fSwibW9iaWxlIjp7fX19" parallax_scroll="no" wd_hide_on_desktop="no" wd_hide_on_tablet="no" wd_hide_on_mobile="no"]

How to Care for Croton

[/woodmart_text_block][woodmart_list size="medium" list_type="image" image="28" woodmart_css_id="6489b70f5dbc4" list_items_gap="eyJkZXZpY2VzIjp7ImRlc2t0b3AiOnsidW5pdCI6InB4IiwidmFsdWUiOiIxNSJ9LCJ0YWJsZXQiOnsidW5pdCI6InB4IiwidmFsdWUiOiIwIn0sIm1vYmlsZSI6eyJ1bml0IjoicHgiLCJ2YWx1ZSI6IjAifX19" list="%5B%7B%22list-content%22%3A%22Place%20croton%20in%20a%20sunny%20location%20such%20as%20an%20eastern%2C%20southern%2C%20or%20western%20window.%22%2C%22item_type%22%3A%22inherit%22%7D%2C%7B%22list-content%22%3A%22Keep%20the%20soil%20evenly%20moist%2C%20but%20let%20it%20dry%20out%20between%20waterings.%22%2C%22item_type%22%3A%22inherit%22%7D%2C%7B%22list-content%22%3A%22If%20humidity%20is%20low%20in%20your%20home%2C%20mist%20around%20the%20leaves%20with%20water%20once%20a%20week.%22%2C%22item_type%22%3A%22inherit%22%7D%2C%7B%22list-content%22%3A%22Gently%20wipe%20the%20leaves%20with%20a%20moist%20cloth%20twice%20a%20month%20to%20keep%20them%20clean.%22%2C%22item_type%22%3A%22inherit%22%7D%5D" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDg5YjcwZjVkYmM0Iiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfbGlzdCIsImRhdGEiOnsidGFibGV0Ijp7fSwibW9iaWxlIjp7fX19" img_size="6x6" css=".vc_custom_1686746904814{margin-left: 10px !important;}"][woodmart_image rounding_size="" woodmart_css_id="6489b71a7d3ad" img_id="237" img_size="full" display_inline="no" parallax_scroll="no" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDg5YjcxYTdkM2FkIiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfaW1hZ2UiLCJkYXRhIjp7InRhYmxldCI6e30sIm1vYmlsZSI6e319fQ==" woodmart_box_shadow="no" wd_hide_on_desktop="no" wd_hide_on_tablet="no" wd_hide_on_mobile="no"][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded:
This plant is native to the tropical forests of Southeast Asia and Oceania. For decades, plants in the Croton family were considered outdoor-only, needing several hours of direct light to thrive.
Croton petra plants are susceptible to the bacterial diseases crown gall and xanthomonas leaf spot, and the fungal diseases anthracnose and stem gall and canker...

item.excerpt:encoded:
A plant stand makes it possible to decorate with plants everywhere in the home. The pot stand fits both large and small pots. All you need to do is turn the stand over.
Take your plants to new heights. With Svartpeppar plant stand you can put your pots on display and make the area livelier – both indoors and outdoors.

In the wild, they grow as large shrubs, reaching up to 10 feet tall (in the home or garden, they stay a lot smaller). Croton petra plants are susceptible to the bacterial diseases crown gall and xanthomonas leaf spot, and the fungal diseases anthracnose and stem gall and canker. Both crown gall and stem gall and canker present with swelling on the plant's stems, leaf veins and roots and require the pruning of all infected parts in order to be controlled. Xanthomonas leaf spot is identified through the dark brown and black lesions that appear on the leaves. A copper containing bactericide can be used preventatively, but once the plant is infected, it will need to be eliminated. If your plant has anthracnose, you'll notice water spots that turn tan and sometimes have black dots in the center. Note: All parts of this plant are poisonous—especially the seeds—so it is not recommended for use in homes with curious pets or children. item.excerpt:encoded:
A plant stand makes it possible to decorate with plants everywhere in the home. The pot stand fits both large and small pots. All you need to do is turn the stand over.
Take your plants to new heights. With Svartpeppar plant stand you can put your pots on display and make the area livelier – both indoors and outdoors.

Croton, also called \u201cgarden croton,\u201d are native to the tropical forests of southeast Asia and Oceania. In the wild, they grow as large shrubs, reaching up to 10 feet tall (in the home or garden, they stay a lot smaller).

Croton petra plants are susceptible to the bacterial diseases crown gall and xanthomonas leaf spot, and the fungal diseases anthracnose and stem gall and canker. Both crown gall and stem gall and canker present with swelling on the plant's stems, leaf veins and roots and require the pruning of all infected parts in order to be controlled. Xanthomonas leaf spot is identified through the dark brown and black lesions that appear on the leaves. A copper containing bactericide can be used preventatively, but once the plant is infected, it will need to be eliminated. If your plant has anthracnose, you'll notice water spots that turn tan and sometimes have black dots in the center.

Note: All parts of this plant are poisonous\u2014especially the seeds\u2014so it is not recommended for use in homes with curious pets or children. item.excerpt:encoded: Get your hands dirty with our custom made organic, peat-free potting soil. This nutritionally balanced formula has been designed by indoor plant specialists and includes the perfect combination of ingredients to ensure optimal absorption and plant growth.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
[{"id":"ad61709","elType":"section","settings":{"structure":"20","gap":"extended"},"elements":[{"id":"089fc49","elType":"column","settings":{"_column_size":50,"_inline_size":null,"column_sticky_offset":50,"scroll_y":-80},"elements":[{"id":"589f4e7","elType":"widget","settings":{"subtitle":"","title":"Plants","after_title":"","size":"large","align":"left","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_title"},{"id":"52fca81","elType":"widget","settings":{"text":"

Croton, also called \u201cgarden croton,\u201d are native to the tropical forests of southeast Asia and Oceania. In the wild, they grow as large shrubs, reaching up to 10 feet tall (in the home or garden, they stay a lot smaller).

Croton petra plants are susceptible to the bacterial diseases crown gall and xanthomonas leaf spot, and the fungal diseases anthracnose and stem gall and canker. Both crown gall and stem gall and canker present with swelling on the plant's stems, leaf veins and roots and require the pruning of all infected parts in order to be controlled. Xanthomonas leaf spot is identified through the dark brown and black lesions that appear on the leaves. A copper containing bactericide can be used preventatively, but once the plant is infected, it will need to be eliminated. If your plant has anthracnose, you'll notice water spots that turn tan and sometimes have black dots in the center.

Note: All parts of this plant are poisonous\u2014especially the seeds\u2014so it is not recommended for use in homes with curious pets or children. When damaged, croton produce a milky sap that can be irritating to the skin, too.","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_text_block"},{"id":"73ed8e0","elType":"widget","settings":{"icon_type":"icon","icon_text":"53","image":{"url":"http:\/\/dummy.xtemos.com\/woodmart2\/plants-elementor\/wp-content\/uploads\/sites\/12\/2023\/06\/w-ps-product-care-library.png","id":185,"size":"","alt":"","source":"library"},"image_size":"custom","image_custom_dimension":{"width":"103","height":"110"},"subtitle":"","title":"Visit the plant care library","content":"

Here you will find many useful tips for caring your plants.","btn_text":"Care library","link":{"url":"https:\/\/dummy.xtemos.com\/woodmart2\/plants-elementor\/care-library\/","is_external":false,"nofollow":false,"custom_attributes":""},"alignment":"left","image_alignment":"left","image_vertical_alignment":"middle","title_size":"large","padding":{"unit":"px","top":"40","right":"40","bottom":"40","left":"40","isLinked":true},"box_bg_color":"#F6F3ED","btn_color":"primary","btn_style":"link","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_infobox"}],"isInner":false},{"id":"49dd85d","elType":"column","settings":{"_column_size":50,"_inline_size":null,"column_sticky_offset":50,"scroll_y":-80},"elements":[{"id":"5fd4418","elType":"widget","settings":{"text":"

How to Care for Croton","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_text_block"},{"id":"74f124b","elType":"widget","settings":{"list_items":[{"list_content":"Place croton in a sunny location such as an eastern, southern, or western window.\nwd-furniture-dot-list","_id":"01db63c"},{"list_content":"Keep the soil evenly moist, but let it dry out between waterings.","_id":"b31ab18"},{"list_content":"If humidity is low in your home, mist around the leaves with water once a week.","_id":"0a2e8f7"},{"list_content":"Gently wipe the leaves with a moist cloth twice a month to keep them clean.","_id":"d518e2d"}],"list_type":"image","size":"medium","scroll_y":-80,"image":{"url":"http:\/\/dummy.xtemos.com\/woodmart2\/plants-elementor\/wp-content\/uploads\/sites\/12\/2023\/06\/wd-furniture-dot-list.svg","id":196,"size":"","alt":"","source":"library"},"image_size":"custom","image_custom_dimension":{"width":"6","height":"6"}},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_list"},{"id":"4961dbf","elType":"widget","settings":{"image":{"url":"http:\/\/dummy.xtemos.com\/woodmart2\/plants-elementor\/wp-content\/uploads\/sites\/12\/2023\/06\/w-ps-product-description-opt.jpg","id":200,"size":"","alt":"","source":"library"},"scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_image_or_svg"}],"isInner":false}],"isInner":false}]

In the wild, they grow as large shrubs, reaching up to 10 feet tall (in the home or garden, they stay a lot smaller). Croton petra plants are susceptible to the bacterial diseases crown gall and xanthomonas leaf spot, and the fungal diseases anthracnose and stem gall and canker. Both crown gall and stem gall and canker present with swelling on the plant's stems, leaf veins and roots and require the pruning of all infected parts in order to be controlled. Xanthomonas leaf spot is identified through the dark brown and black lesions that appear on the leaves. A copper containing bactericide can be used preventatively, but once the plant is infected, it will need to be eliminated. item.excerpt:encoded: Get your hands dirty with our custom made organic, peat-free potting soil. This nutritionally balanced formula has been designed by indoor plant specialists and includes the perfect combination of ingredients to ensure optimal absorption and plant growth.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
[{"id":"ad61709","elType":"section","settings":{"structure":"20","gap":"extended"},"elements":[{"id":"089fc49","elType":"column","settings":{"_column_size":50,"_inline_size":null,"column_sticky_offset":50,"scroll_y":-80},"elements":[{"id":"589f4e7","elType":"widget","settings":{"subtitle":"","title":"Plants","after_title":"","size":"large","align":"left","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_title"},{"id":"52fca81","elType":"widget","settings":{"text":"

Croton, also called \u201cgarden croton,\u201d are native to the tropical forests of southeast Asia and Oceania. In the wild, they grow as large shrubs, reaching up to 10 feet tall (in the home or garden, they stay a lot smaller).

Croton petra plants are susceptible to the bacterial diseases crown gall and xanthomonas leaf spot, and the fungal diseases anthracnose and stem gall and canker. Both crown gall and stem gall and canker present with swelling on the plant's stems, leaf veins and roots and require the pruning of all infected parts in order to be controlled. Xanthomonas leaf spot is identified through the dark brown and black lesions that appear on the leaves. A copper containing bactericide can be used preventatively, but once the plant is infected, it will need to be eliminated. If your plant has anthracnose, you'll notice water spots that turn tan and sometimes have black dots in the center.

Note: All parts of this plant are poisonous\u2014especially the seeds\u2014so it is not recommended for use in homes with curious pets or children. When damaged, croton produce a milky sap that can be irritating to the skin, too.","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_text_block"},{"id":"73ed8e0","elType":"widget","settings":{"icon_type":"icon","icon_text":"53","image":{"url":"http:\/\/dummy.xtemos.com\/woodmart2\/plants-elementor\/wp-content\/uploads\/sites\/12\/2023\/06\/w-ps-product-care-library.png","id":185,"size":"","alt":"","source":"library"},"image_size":"custom","image_custom_dimension":{"width":"103","height":"110"},"subtitle":"","title":"Visit the plant care library","content":"

How to Care for Croton","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_text_block"},{"id":"74f124b","elType":"widget","settings":{"list_items":[{"list_content":"Place croton in a sunny location such as an eastern, southern, or western window.\nwd-furniture-dot-list","_id":"01db63c"},{"list_content":"Keep the soil evenly moist, but let it dry out between waterings.","_id":"b31ab18"},{"list_content":"If humidity is low in your home, mist around the leaves with water once a week.","_id":"0a2e8f7"},{"list_content":"Gently wipe the leaves with a moist cloth twice a month to keep them clean.","_id":"d518e2d"}],"list_type":"image","size":"medium","scroll_y":-80,"image":{"url":"http:\/\/dummy.xtemos.com\/woodmart2\/plants-elementor\/wp-content\/uploads\/sites\/12\/2023\/06\/wd-furniture-dot-list.svg","id":196,"size":"","alt":"","source":"library"},"image_size":"custom","image_custom_dimension":{"width":"6","height":"6"}},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_list"},{"id":"4961dbf","elType":"widget","settings":{"image":{"url":"http:\/\/dummy.xtemos.com\/woodmart2\/plants-elementor\/wp-content\/uploads\/sites\/12\/2023\/06\/w-ps-product-description-opt.jpg","id":200,"size":"","alt":"","source":"library"},"scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_image_or_svg"}],"isInner":false}],"isInner":false}]

Croton petra plants are susceptible to the bacterial diseases crown gall and xanthomonas leaf spot, and the fungal diseases anthracnose and stem gall and canker. Both crown gall and stem gall and canker present with swelling on the plant's stems, leaf veins and roots and require the pruning of all infected parts in order to be controlled. A copper containing bactericide can be used preventatively, but once the plant is infected, it will need to be eliminated. item.excerpt:encoded: Get your hands dirty with our custom made organic, peat-free potting soil. This nutritionally balanced formula has been designed by indoor plant specialists and includes the perfect combination of ingredients to ensure optimal absorption and plant growth.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
[{"id":"ad61709","elType":"section","settings":{"structure":"20","gap":"extended"},"elements":[{"id":"089fc49","elType":"column","settings":{"_column_size":50,"_inline_size":null,"column_sticky_offset":50,"scroll_y":-80},"elements":[{"id":"589f4e7","elType":"widget","settings":{"subtitle":"","title":"Plants","after_title":"","size":"large","align":"left","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_title"},{"id":"52fca81","elType":"widget","settings":{"text":"

Croton, also called \u201cgarden croton,\u201d are native to the tropical forests of southeast Asia and Oceania. In the wild, they grow as large shrubs, reaching up to 10 feet tall (in the home or garden, they stay a lot smaller).

Croton petra plants are susceptible to the bacterial diseases crown gall and xanthomonas leaf spot, and the fungal diseases anthracnose and stem gall and canker. Both crown gall and stem gall and canker present with swelling on the plant's stems, leaf veins and roots and require the pruning of all infected parts in order to be controlled. Xanthomonas leaf spot is identified through the dark brown and black lesions that appear on the leaves. A copper containing bactericide can be used preventatively, but once the plant is infected, it will need to be eliminated. If your plant has anthracnose, you'll notice water spots that turn tan and sometimes have black dots in the center.

Note: All parts of this plant are poisonous\u2014especially the seeds\u2014so it is not recommended for use in homes with curious pets or children. When damaged, croton produce a milky sap that can be irritating to the skin, too.","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_text_block"},{"id":"73ed8e0","elType":"widget","settings":{"icon_type":"icon","icon_text":"53","image":{"url":"http:\/\/dummy.xtemos.com\/woodmart2\/plants-elementor\/wp-content\/uploads\/sites\/12\/2023\/06\/w-ps-product-care-library.png","id":185,"size":"","alt":"","source":"library"},"image_size":"custom","image_custom_dimension":{"width":"103","height":"110"},"subtitle":"","title":"Visit the plant care library","content":"

Here you will find many useful tips for caring your plants.","btn_text":"Care library","link":{"url":"https:\/\/dummy.xtemos.com\/woodmart2\/plants-elementor\/care-library\/","is_external":false,"nofollow":false,"custom_attributes":""},"alignment":"left","image_alignment":"left","image_vertical_alignment":"middle","title_size":"large","padding":{"unit":"px","top":"40","right":"40","bottom":"40","left":"40","isLinked":true},"box_bg_color":"#F6F3ED","btn_color":"primary","btn_style":"link","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_infobox"}],"isInner":false},{"id":"49dd85d","elType":"column","settings":{"_column_size":50,"_inline_size":null,"column_sticky_offset":50,"scroll_y":-80},"elements":[{"id":"5fd4418","elType":"widget","settings":{"text":"

How to Care for Croton","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_text_block"},{"id":"74f124b","elType":"widget","settings":{"list_items":[{"list_content":"Place croton in a sunny location such as an eastern, southern, or western window.\nwd-furniture-dot-list","_id":"01db63c"},{"list_content":"Keep the soil evenly moist, but let it dry out between waterings.","_id":"b31ab18"},{"list_content":"If humidity is low in your home, mist around the leaves with water once a week.","_id":"0a2e8f7"},{"list_content":"Gently wipe the leaves with a moist cloth twice a month to keep them clean.","_id":"d518e2d"}],"list_type":"image","size":"medium","scroll_y":-80,"image":{"url":"http:\/\/dummy.xtemos.com\/woodmart2\/plants-elementor\/wp-content\/uploads\/sites\/12\/2023\/06\/wd-furniture-dot-list.svg","id":196,"size":"","alt":"","source":"library"},"image_size":"custom","image_custom_dimension":{"width":"6","height":"6"}},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_list"},{"id":"4961dbf","elType":"widget","settings":{"image":{"url":"http:\/\/dummy.xtemos.com\/woodmart2\/plants-elementor\/wp-content\/uploads\/sites\/12\/2023\/06\/w-ps-product-description-opt.jpg","id":200,"size":"","alt":"","source":"library"},"scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_image_or_svg"}],"isInner":false}],"isInner":false}]

In the wild, they grow as large shrubs, reaching up to 10 feet tall (in the home or garden, they stay a lot smaller). Croton petra plants are susceptible to the bacterial diseases crown gall and xanthomonas leaf spot, and the fungal diseases anthracnose and stem gall and canker. Both crown gall and stem gall and canker present with swelling on the plant's stems, leaf veins and roots and require the pruning of all infected parts in order to be controlled. Xanthomonas leaf spot is identified through the dark brown and black lesions that appear on the leaves. A copper containing bactericide can be used preventatively, but once the plant is infected, it will need to be eliminated. If your plant has anthracnose, you'll notice water spots that turn tan and sometimes have black dots in the center. item.excerpt:encoded: Get your hands dirty with our custom made organic, peat-free potting soil. This nutritionally balanced formula has been designed by indoor plant specialists and includes the perfect combination of ingredients to ensure optimal absorption and plant growth.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
[{"id":"ad61709","elType":"section","settings":{"structure":"20","gap":"extended"},"elements":[{"id":"089fc49","elType":"column","settings":{"_column_size":50,"_inline_size":null,"column_sticky_offset":50,"scroll_y":-80},"elements":[{"id":"589f4e7","elType":"widget","settings":{"subtitle":"","title":"Plants","after_title":"","size":"large","align":"left","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_title"},{"id":"52fca81","elType":"widget","settings":{"text":"

Croton, also called \u201cgarden croton,\u201d are native to the tropical forests of southeast Asia and Oceania. In the wild, they grow as large shrubs, reaching up to 10 feet tall (in the home or garden, they stay a lot smaller).

Croton petra plants are susceptible to the bacterial diseases crown gall and xanthomonas leaf spot, and the fungal diseases anthracnose and stem gall and canker. Both crown gall and stem gall and canker present with swelling on the plant's stems, leaf veins and roots and require the pruning of all infected parts in order to be controlled. Xanthomonas leaf spot is identified through the dark brown and black lesions that appear on the leaves. A copper containing bactericide can be used preventatively, but once the plant is infected, it will need to be eliminated. If your plant has anthracnose, you'll notice water spots that turn tan and sometimes have black dots in the center.

Note: All parts of this plant are poisonous\u2014especially the seeds\u2014so it is not recommended for use in homes with curious pets or children. When damaged, croton produce a milky sap that can be irritating to the skin, too.","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_text_block"},{"id":"73ed8e0","elType":"widget","settings":{"icon_type":"icon","icon_text":"53","image":{"url":"http:\/\/dummy.xtemos.com\/woodmart2\/plants-elementor\/wp-content\/uploads\/sites\/12\/2023\/06\/w-ps-product-care-library.png","id":185,"size":"","alt":"","source":"library"},"image_size":"custom","image_custom_dimension":{"width":"103","height":"110"},"subtitle":"","title":"Visit the plant care library","content":"

Here you will find many useful tips for caring your plants.","btn_text":"Care library","link":{"url":"https:\/\/dummy.xtemos.com\/woodmart2\/plants-elementor\/care-library\/","is_external":false,"nofollow":false,"custom_attributes":""},"alignment":"left","image_alignment":"left","image_vertical_alignment":"middle","title_size":"large","padding":{"unit":"px","top":"40","right":"40","bottom":"40","left":"40","isLinked":true},"box_bg_color":"#F6F3ED","btn_color":"primary","btn_style":"link","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_infobox"}],"isInner":false},{"id":"49dd85d","elType":"column","settings":{"_column_size":50,"_inline_size":null,"column_sticky_offset":50,"scroll_y":-80},"elements":[{"id":"5fd4418","elType":"widget","settings":{"text":"

How to Care for Croton","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_text_block"},{"id":"74f124b","elType":"widget","settings":{"list_items":[{"list_content":"Place croton in a sunny location such as an eastern, southern, or western window.\nwd-furniture-dot-list","_id":"01db63c"},{"list_content":"Keep the soil evenly moist, but let it dry out between waterings.","_id":"b31ab18"},{"list_content":"If humidity is low in your home, mist around the leaves with water once a week.","_id":"0a2e8f7"},{"list_content":"Gently wipe the leaves with a moist cloth twice a month to keep them clean.","_id":"d518e2d"}],"list_type":"image","size":"medium","scroll_y":-80,"image":{"url":"http:\/\/dummy.xtemos.com\/woodmart2\/plants-elementor\/wp-content\/uploads\/sites\/12\/2023\/06\/wd-furniture-dot-list.svg","id":196,"size":"","alt":"","source":"library"},"image_size":"custom","image_custom_dimension":{"width":"6","height":"6"}},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_list"},{"id":"4961dbf","elType":"widget","settings":{"image":{"url":"http:\/\/dummy.xtemos.com\/woodmart2\/plants-elementor\/wp-content\/uploads\/sites\/12\/2023\/06\/w-ps-product-description-opt.jpg","id":200,"size":"","alt":"","source":"library"},"scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_image_or_svg"}],"isInner":false}],"isInner":false}]

How to Care for Croton

[/woodmart_text_block][woodmart_list size="medium" list_type="image" image="28" woodmart_css_id="6489b70f5dbc4" list_items_gap="eyJkZXZpY2VzIjp7ImRlc2t0b3AiOnsidW5pdCI6InB4IiwidmFsdWUiOiIxNSJ9LCJ0YWJsZXQiOnsidW5pdCI6InB4IiwidmFsdWUiOiIwIn0sIm1vYmlsZSI6eyJ1bml0IjoicHgiLCJ2YWx1ZSI6IjAifX19" list="%5B%7B%22list-content%22%3A%22Place%20croton%20in%20a%20sunny%20location%20such%20as%20an%20eastern%2C%20southern%2C%20or%20western%20window.%22%2C%22item_type%22%3A%22inherit%22%7D%2C%7B%22list-content%22%3A%22Keep%20the%20soil%20evenly%20moist%2C%20but%20let%20it%20dry%20out%20between%20waterings.%22%2C%22item_type%22%3A%22inherit%22%7D%2C%7B%22list-content%22%3A%22If%20humidity%20is%20low%20in%20your%20home%2C%20mist%20around%20the%20leaves%20with%20water%20once%20a%20week.%22%2C%22item_type%22%3A%22inherit%22%7D%2C%7B%22list-content%22%3A%22Gently%20wipe%20the%20leaves%20with%20a%20moist%20cloth%20twice%20a%20month%20to%20keep%20them%20clean.%22%2C%22item_type%22%3A%22inherit%22%7D%5D" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDg5YjcwZjVkYmM0Iiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfbGlzdCIsImRhdGEiOnsidGFibGV0Ijp7fSwibW9iaWxlIjp7fX19" img_size="6x6" css=".vc_custom_1686746904814{margin-left: 10px !important;}"][woodmart_image rounding_size="" woodmart_css_id="6489b71a7d3ad" img_id="237" img_size="full" display_inline="no" parallax_scroll="no" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDg5YjcxYTdkM2FkIiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfaW1hZ2UiLCJkYXRhIjp7InRhYmxldCI6e30sIm1vYmlsZSI6e319fQ==" woodmart_box_shadow="no" wd_hide_on_desktop="no" wd_hide_on_tablet="no" wd_hide_on_mobile="no"][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: Get your hands dirty with our custom made organic, peat-free potting soil. This nutritionally balanced formula has been designed by indoor plant specialists and includes the perfect combination of ingredients to ensure optimal absorption and plant growth.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
[{"id":"ad61709","elType":"section","settings":{"structure":"20","gap":"extended"},"elements":[{"id":"089fc49","elType":"column","settings":{"_column_size":50,"_inline_size":null,"column_sticky_offset":50,"scroll_y":-80},"elements":[{"id":"589f4e7","elType":"widget","settings":{"subtitle":"","title":"Plants","after_title":"","size":"large","align":"left","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_title"},{"id":"52fca81","elType":"widget","settings":{"text":"

Croton, also called \u201cgarden croton,\u201d are native to the tropical forests of southeast Asia and Oceania. In the wild, they grow as large shrubs, reaching up to 10 feet tall (in the home or garden, they stay a lot smaller).

Croton petra plants are susceptible to the bacterial diseases crown gall and xanthomonas leaf spot, and the fungal diseases anthracnose and stem gall and canker. Both crown gall and stem gall and canker present with swelling on the plant's stems, leaf veins and roots and require the pruning of all infected parts in order to be controlled. Xanthomonas leaf spot is identified through the dark brown and black lesions that appear on the leaves. A copper containing bactericide can be used preventatively, but once the plant is infected, it will need to be eliminated. If your plant has anthracnose, you'll notice water spots that turn tan and sometimes have black dots in the center.

Note: All parts of this plant are poisonous\u2014especially the seeds\u2014so it is not recommended for use in homes with curious pets or children. When damaged, croton produce a milky sap that can be irritating to the skin, too.","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_text_block"},{"id":"73ed8e0","elType":"widget","settings":{"icon_type":"icon","icon_text":"53","image":{"url":"http:\/\/dummy.xtemos.com\/woodmart2\/plants-elementor\/wp-content\/uploads\/sites\/12\/2023\/06\/w-ps-product-care-library.png","id":185,"size":"","alt":"","source":"library"},"image_size":"custom","image_custom_dimension":{"width":"103","height":"110"},"subtitle":"","title":"Visit the plant care library","content":"

How to Care for Croton","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_text_block"},{"id":"74f124b","elType":"widget","settings":{"list_items":[{"list_content":"Place croton in a sunny location such as an eastern, southern, or western window.\nwd-furniture-dot-list","_id":"01db63c"},{"list_content":"Keep the soil evenly moist, but let it dry out between waterings.","_id":"b31ab18"},{"list_content":"If humidity is low in your home, mist around the leaves with water once a week.","_id":"0a2e8f7"},{"list_content":"Gently wipe the leaves with a moist cloth twice a month to keep them clean.","_id":"d518e2d"}],"list_type":"image","size":"medium","scroll_y":-80,"image":{"url":"http:\/\/dummy.xtemos.com\/woodmart2\/plants-elementor\/wp-content\/uploads\/sites\/12\/2023\/06\/wd-furniture-dot-list.svg","id":196,"size":"","alt":"","source":"library"},"image_size":"custom","image_custom_dimension":{"width":"6","height":"6"}},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_list"},{"id":"4961dbf","elType":"widget","settings":{"image":{"url":"http:\/\/dummy.xtemos.com\/woodmart2\/plants-elementor\/wp-content\/uploads\/sites\/12\/2023\/06\/w-ps-product-description-opt.jpg","id":200,"size":"","alt":"","source":"library"},"scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_image_or_svg"}],"isInner":false}],"isInner":false}]

item.title: What is biophilic design?
item.dc:creator: zakhar
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][woodmart_text_block woodmart_css_id="645cbae9e0072" woodmart_inline="no" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDVjYmFlOWUwMDcyIiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfdGV4dF9ibG9jayIsImRhdGEiOnsidGFibGV0Ijp7fSwibW9iaWxlIjp7fX19" parallax_scroll="no" wd_hide_on_desktop="no" wd_hide_on_tablet="no" wd_hide_on_mobile="no"]You begin with a text, you sculpt information, you chisel away what's not needed, you come to the point, make things clear, add value, you're a content person, you like words.

Design is no afterthought, far from it, but it comes in a deserved second. Anyway, you still use Lorem Ipsum and rightly so, as it will always have a place in the web workers toolbox, as things happen, not always the way you like it, not always in the preferred order.[/woodmart_text_block][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/2"][woodmart_image rounding_size="" woodmart_css_id="6489c0d204a87" display_inline="no" parallax_scroll="no" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDg5YzBkMjA0YTg3Iiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfaW1hZ2UiLCJkYXRhIjp7InRhYmxldCI6e30sIm1vYmlsZSI6e319fQ==" woodmart_box_shadow="no" wd_hide_on_desktop="no" wd_hide_on_tablet="no" wd_hide_on_mobile="no" img_id="304" img_size="full"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][woodmart_text_block woodmart_css_id="645cca37a7925" woodmart_inline="no" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDVjY2EzN2E3OTI1Iiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfdGV4dF9ibG9jayIsImRhdGEiOnsidGFibGV0Ijp7fSwibW9iaWxlIjp7fX19" parallax_scroll="no" wd_hide_on_desktop="no" wd_hide_on_tablet="no" wd_hide_on_mobile="no"]

Plant Details

Fiddle Leaf Figs are a popular plant with interior designers and often appear in the pages of trendy magazines as a staple of fashion brand photography. Standing at over 6 feet tall the Fiddle Leaf Fig Tree is the perfect balance of volume and grace. This plant is truly a must-have for all who appreciate style and greenery.

Even if your less into design and more into content strategy you may find some redeeming value with, wait for it, dummy copy, no less. Consider this: You made all the required mock ups for commissioned layout, got all the approvals.

Note: this plant is hyper-sensitive to environmental changes. The plant might shed leaves in the first weeks as it adapts to new light, humidity, and temperature conditions.

  • Sized to fit 14" or 7g grower pots with extra room for drainage
  • Glazed inside and out, completely waterproof
  • No drainage hole, plant should be staged, ideal for indoor or outdoor use
  • Elevated by a sleek wood stand - teak wood for the light and dark stained options, mahogany wood for the black stained option
  • Finished with non-toxic, non-VOC oil

[/woodmart_text_block][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][woodmart_text_block woodmart_css_id="645cca7b60f6c" woodmart_inline="no" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDVjY2E3YjYwZjZjIiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfdGV4dF9ibG9jayIsImRhdGEiOnsidGFibGV0Ijp7fSwibW9iaWxlIjp7fX19" parallax_scroll="no" wd_hide_on_desktop="no" wd_hide_on_tablet="no" wd_hide_on_mobile="no"]Chances are there wasn't collaboration, communication, and checkpoints, there wasn't a process agreed upon or specified with the granularity required. It's content strategy gone awry right from the start. Forswearing the use of Lorem Ipsum wouldn't have helped, won't help now. It's like saying you're a bad designer, use less bold text, don't use italics in every other paragraph. True enough, but that's not all that it takes to get things back on track.[/woodmart_text_block][woodmart_products layout="carousel" spacing="20" slides_per_view="3" rounding_size="" woodmart_css_id="645cca8a2c0b7" autoplay="no" hide_pagination_control="yes" hide_prev_next_buttons="no" center_mode="no" wrap="no" sale_countdown="0" stock_progress_bar="0" highlighted_products="0" products_bordered_grid="0" products_with_background="0" products_shadow="0" hide_out_of_stock="no" lazy_loading="no" scroll_carousel_init="no" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDVjY2E4YTJjMGI3Iiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcHJvZHVjdHMiLCJkYXRhIjp7InRhYmxldCI6e30sIm1vYmlsZSI6e319fQ=="][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: The benefits of houseplants
item.dc:creator: zakhar
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][woodmart_text_block woodmart_css_id="645ccb40025cc" woodmart_inline="no" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDVjY2I0MDAyNWNjIiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfdGV4dF9ibG9jayIsImRhdGEiOnsidGFibGV0Ijp7fSwibW9iaWxlIjp7fX19" parallax_scroll="no" wd_hide_on_desktop="no" wd_hide_on_tablet="no" wd_hide_on_mobile="no"]Chances are there wasn’t collaboration, communication, and checkpoints, there wasn’t a process agreed upon or specified with the granularity required. It’s content strategy gone awry right from the start. Forswearing the use of Lorem Ipsum wouldn’t have helped, won’t help now. It’s like saying you’re a bad designer, use less bold text, don’t use italics in every other paragraph. True enough, but that’s not all that it takes to get things back on track.

I’ve heard the argument that “lorem ipsum” is effective in wireframing or design because it helps people focus on the actual layout, or color scheme, or whatever. What kills me here is that we’re talking about creating a user experience that will (whether we like it or not) be DRIVEN by words. The entire structure of the page or app flow is FOR THE WORDS.[/woodmart_text_block][vc_row_inner css=".vc_custom_1683803053314{margin-bottom: 10px !important;}" woodmart_css_id="645ccba9c9916" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDVjY2JhOWM5OTE2Iiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoidmNfcm93X2lubmVyIiwiZGF0YSI6eyJ0YWJsZXQiOnt9LCJtb2JpbGUiOnt9fX0=" mobile_bg_img_hidden="no" tablet_bg_img_hidden="no" woodmart_parallax="0" woodmart_gradient_switch="no" woodmart_box_shadow="no" wd_z_index="no" woodmart_disable_overflow="0" row_reverse_mobile="0" row_reverse_tablet="0"][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][woodmart_text_block woodmart_css_id="645ccbc181c6d" woodmart_inline="no" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDVjY2JjMTgxYzZkIiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfdGV4dF9ibG9jayIsImRhdGEiOnsidGFibGV0Ijp7fSwibW9iaWxlIjp7fX19" parallax_scroll="no" wd_hide_on_desktop="no" wd_hide_on_tablet="no" wd_hide_on_mobile="no" css=".vc_custom_1683803078610{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]If that’s what you think how bout the other way around? How can you evaluate content without design? No typography, no colors, no layout, no styles, all those things that convey the important signals that go beyond the mere textual, hierarchies of information, weight, emphasis, oblique stresses, priorities, all those subtle cues that also have visual and emotional appeal to the reader. Rigid proponents of content strategy may shun the use of dummy copy but then designers might want to ask them to provide style sheets.[/woodmart_text_block][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][woodmart_text_block woodmart_css_id="645ccb9b4c6c0" woodmart_inline="no" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDVjY2I5YjRjNmMwIiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfdGV4dF9ibG9jayIsImRhdGEiOnsidGFibGV0Ijp7fSwibW9iaWxlIjp7fX19" parallax_scroll="no" wd_hide_on_desktop="no" wd_hide_on_tablet="no" wd_hide_on_mobile="no" css=".vc_custom_1683803043179{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]Websites in professional use templating systems. Commercial publishing platforms and content management systems ensure that you can show different text, different data using the same template. When it's about controlling hundreds of articles, product pages for web shops, or user profiles in social networks, all of them potentially with different sizes, formats, rules for differing elements things can break, designs agreed upon can have unintended consequences and look much different than expected.[/woodmart_text_block][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][woodmart_gallery images="267,269,270,271" rounding_size="" view="carousel" spacing="20" woodmart_css_id="6489c09655e9f" img_size="full" autoplay="no" hide_pagination_control="yes" hide_prev_next_buttons="no" wrap="no" center_mode="no" caption="0" lazy_loading="no" scroll_carousel_init="no" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDg5YzA5NjU1ZTlmIiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfZ2FsbGVyeSIsImRhdGEiOnsidGFibGV0Ijp7fSwibW9iaWxlIjp7fX19" woodmart_empty_space=""][/vc_column][/vc_row]

[vc_row][vc_column][woodmart_text_block woodmart_css_id="645ccbfa72af8" woodmart_inline="no" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDVjY2JmYTcyYWY4Iiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfdGV4dF9ibG9jayIsImRhdGEiOnsidGFibGV0Ijp7fSwibW9iaWxlIjp7fX19" parallax_scroll="no" wd_hide_on_desktop="no" wd_hide_on_tablet="no" wd_hide_on_mobile="no"]Websites in professional use templating systems. Commercial publishing platforms and content management systems ensure that you can show different text, different data using the same template. When it's about controlling hundreds of articles, product pages for web shops, or user profiles in social networks, all of them potentially with different sizes, formats, rules for differing elements things can break, designs agreed upon can have unintended consequences and look much different than expected.

What's included

When you purchase a plant from Léon & George, each order is prepared with the utmost care and service:
  • Sourced from top California growers
  • Hand-selected for health, shape and beauty
  • Cleaned and shined with our own all-natural soaps
  • Trimmed and pruned for blemishes
  • Inspected and treated with systemic bug protection
  • Soil is topped with preserved forest moss for a refined finished touch
  • Carefully wrapped, packed and sealed for their journey to you
When ordered with a ceramic pot, your set is assembled with our staging method for optimal airflow and drainage. Léon & George plants are fitted into the highest quality of small batch, hand-finished stoneware ceramic pots, which are renowned for their high-fire, waterproof, ultra-strong material.[/woodmart_text_block][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1683803465632{margin-right: -10px !important;margin-left: -10px !important;}" woodmart_css_id="645ccd3c5551e" How can you evaluate content without design? No typography, no colors, no layout, no styles, all those things that convey the important signals that go beyond the mere textual, hierarchies of information, weight, emphasis, oblique stresses, priorities, all those subtle cues that also have visual and emotional appeal to the reader. Rigid proponents of content strategy may shun the use of dummy copy but then designers might want to ask them to provide style sheets with the copy decks they supply that are in tune with the design direction they require.[/woodmart_text_block][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Top 10 Tips and Tricks To Beat the Winter Blues
item.dc:creator: zakhar
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][woodmart_text_block woodmart_css_id="645cbae9e0072" woodmart_inline="no" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDVjYmFlOWUwMDcyIiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfdGV4dF9ibG9jayIsImRhdGEiOnsidGFibGV0Ijp7fSwibW9iaWxlIjp7fX19" parallax_scroll="no" wd_hide_on_desktop="no" wd_hide_on_tablet="no" wd_hide_on_mobile="no"]You begin with a text, you sculpt information, you chisel away what's not needed, you come to the point, make things clear, add value, you're a content person, you like words.

Design is no afterthought, far from it, but it comes in a deserved second. Anyway, you still use Lorem Ipsum and rightly so, as it will always have a place in the web workers toolbox, as things happen, not always the way you like it, not always in the preferred order.[/woodmart_text_block][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/2"][woodmart_image rounding_size="" woodmart_css_id="6489c0d204a87" display_inline="no" parallax_scroll="no" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDg5YzBkMjA0YTg3Iiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfaW1hZ2UiLCJkYXRhIjp7InRhYmxldCI6e30sIm1vYmlsZSI6e319fQ==" woodmart_box_shadow="no" wd_hide_on_desktop="no" wd_hide_on_tablet="no" wd_hide_on_mobile="no" img_id="304" img_size="full"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][woodmart_text_block woodmart_css_id="645cca37a7925" woodmart_inline="no" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDVjY2EzN2E3OTI1Iiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfdGV4dF9ibG9jayIsImRhdGEiOnsidGFibGV0Ijp7fSwibW9iaWxlIjp7fX19" parallax_scroll="no" wd_hide_on_desktop="no" wd_hide_on_tablet="no" wd_hide_on_mobile="no"]

Plant Details

Fiddle Leaf Figs are a popular plant with interior designers and often appear in the pages of trendy magazines as a staple of fashion brand photography. Standing at over 6 feet tall the Fiddle Leaf Fig Tree is the perfect balance of volume and grace. This plant is truly a must-have for all who appreciate style and greenery.

Even if your less into design and more into content strategy you may find some redeeming value with, wait for it, dummy copy, no less. Consider this: You made all the required mock ups for commissioned layout, got all the approvals.

Note: this plant is hyper-sensitive to environmental changes. The plant might shed leaves in the first weeks as it adapts to new light, humidity, and temperature conditions.

  • Sized to fit 14" or 7g grower pots with extra room for drainage
  • Glazed inside and out, completely waterproof
  • No drainage hole, plant should be staged, ideal for indoor or outdoor use
  • Elevated by a sleek wood stand - teak wood for the light and dark stained options, mahogany wood for the black stained option
  • Finished with non-toxic, non-VOC oil

[/woodmart_text_block][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][woodmart_text_block woodmart_css_id="645cca7b60f6c" woodmart_inline="no" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDVjY2E3YjYwZjZjIiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfdGV4dF9ibG9jayIsImRhdGEiOnsidGFibGV0Ijp7fSwibW9iaWxlIjp7fX19" parallax_scroll="no" wd_hide_on_desktop="no" wd_hide_on_tablet="no" wd_hide_on_mobile="no"]Chances are there wasn't collaboration, communication, and checkpoints, there wasn't a process agreed upon or specified with the granularity required. It's content strategy gone awry right from the start. Forswearing the use of Lorem Ipsum wouldn't have helped, won't help now. It's like saying you're a bad designer, use less bold text, don't use italics in every other paragraph. True enough, but that's not all that it takes to get things back on track.[/woodmart_text_block][woodmart_products layout="carousel" spacing="20" slides_per_view="3" rounding_size="" woodmart_css_id="645cca8a2c0b7" autoplay="no" hide_pagination_control="yes" hide_prev_next_buttons="no" center_mode="no" wrap="no" sale_countdown="0" stock_progress_bar="0" highlighted_products="0" products_bordered_grid="0" products_with_background="0" products_shadow="0" hide_out_of_stock="no" lazy_loading="no" scroll_carousel_init="no" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDVjY2E4YTJjMGI3Iiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcHJvZHVjdHMiLCJkYXRhIjp7InRhYmxldCI6e30sIm1vYmlsZSI6e319fQ=="][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: How Often & How Much You Should Water Houseplants
item.dc:creator: zakhar
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][woodmart_text_block woodmart_css_id="645ccb40025cc" woodmart_inline="no" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDVjY2I0MDAyNWNjIiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfdGV4dF9ibG9jayIsImRhdGEiOnsidGFibGV0Ijp7fSwibW9iaWxlIjp7fX19" parallax_scroll="no" wd_hide_on_desktop="no" wd_hide_on_tablet="no" wd_hide_on_mobile="no"]Chances are there wasn’t collaboration, communication, and checkpoints, there wasn’t a process agreed upon or specified with the granularity required. It’s content strategy gone awry right from the start. Forswearing the use of Lorem Ipsum wouldn’t have helped, won’t help now. It’s like saying you’re a bad designer, use less bold text, don’t use italics in every other paragraph. True enough, but that’s not all that it takes to get things back on track.

I’ve heard the argument that “lorem ipsum” is effective in wireframing or design because it helps people focus on the actual layout, or color scheme, or whatever. What kills me here is that we’re talking about creating a user experience that will (whether we like it or not) be DRIVEN by words. The entire structure of the page or app flow is FOR THE WORDS.[/woodmart_text_block][vc_row_inner css=".vc_custom_1683803053314{margin-bottom: 10px !important;}" woodmart_css_id="645ccba9c9916" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDVjY2JhOWM5OTE2Iiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoidmNfcm93X2lubmVyIiwiZGF0YSI6eyJ0YWJsZXQiOnt9LCJtb2JpbGUiOnt9fX0=" mobile_bg_img_hidden="no" tablet_bg_img_hidden="no" woodmart_parallax="0" woodmart_gradient_switch="no" woodmart_box_shadow="no" wd_z_index="no" woodmart_disable_overflow="0" row_reverse_mobile="0" row_reverse_tablet="0"][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][woodmart_text_block woodmart_css_id="645ccbc181c6d" woodmart_inline="no" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDVjY2JjMTgxYzZkIiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfdGV4dF9ibG9jayIsImRhdGEiOnsidGFibGV0Ijp7fSwibW9iaWxlIjp7fX19" parallax_scroll="no" wd_hide_on_desktop="no" wd_hide_on_tablet="no" wd_hide_on_mobile="no" css=".vc_custom_1683803078610{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]If that’s what you think how bout the other way around? How can you evaluate content without design? No typography, no colors, no layout, no styles, all those things that convey the important signals that go beyond the mere textual, hierarchies of information, weight, emphasis, oblique stresses, priorities, all those subtle cues that also have visual and emotional appeal to the reader. Rigid proponents of content strategy may shun the use of dummy copy but then designers might want to ask them to provide style sheets.[/woodmart_text_block][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][woodmart_text_block woodmart_css_id="645ccb9b4c6c0" woodmart_inline="no" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDVjY2I5YjRjNmMwIiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfdGV4dF9ibG9jayIsImRhdGEiOnsidGFibGV0Ijp7fSwibW9iaWxlIjp7fX19" parallax_scroll="no" wd_hide_on_desktop="no" wd_hide_on_tablet="no" wd_hide_on_mobile="no" css=".vc_custom_1683803043179{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]Websites in professional use templating systems. Commercial publishing platforms and content management systems ensure that you can show different text, different data using the same template. When it's about controlling hundreds of articles, product pages for web shops, or user profiles in social networks, all of them potentially with different sizes, formats, rules for differing elements things can break, designs agreed upon can have unintended consequences and look much different than expected.[/woodmart_text_block][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][woodmart_gallery images="267,269,270,271" rounding_size="" view="carousel" spacing="20" woodmart_css_id="6489c09655e9f" img_size="full" autoplay="no" hide_pagination_control="yes" hide_prev_next_buttons="no" wrap="no" center_mode="no" caption="0" lazy_loading="no" scroll_carousel_init="no" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDg5YzA5NjU1ZTlmIiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfZ2FsbGVyeSIsImRhdGEiOnsidGFibGV0Ijp7fSwibW9iaWxlIjp7fX19" woodmart_empty_space=""][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Flower Arrangement Tips & Tricks from Floral Experts
item.dc:creator: zakhar
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][woodmart_text_block woodmart_css_id="645ccbfa72af8" woodmart_inline="no" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDVjY2JmYTcyYWY4Iiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfdGV4dF9ibG9jayIsImRhdGEiOnsidGFibGV0Ijp7fSwibW9iaWxlIjp7fX19" parallax_scroll="no" wd_hide_on_desktop="no" wd_hide_on_tablet="no" wd_hide_on_mobile="no"]Websites in professional use templating systems. Commercial publishing platforms and content management systems ensure that you can show different text, different data using the same template. When it's about controlling hundreds of articles, product pages for web shops, or user profiles in social networks, all of them potentially with different sizes, formats, rules for differing elements things can break, designs agreed upon can have unintended consequences and look much different than expected.

What's included

When you purchase a plant from Léon & George, each order is prepared with the utmost care and service:
  • Sourced from top California growers
  • Hand-selected for health, shape and beauty
  • Cleaned and shined with our own all-natural soaps
  • Trimmed and pruned for blemishes
  • Inspected and treated with systemic bug protection
  • Soil is topped with preserved forest moss for a refined finished touch
  • Carefully wrapped, packed and sealed for their journey to you
When ordered with a ceramic pot, your set is assembled with our staging method for optimal airflow and drainage. Léon & George plants are fitted into the highest quality of small batch, hand-finished stoneware ceramic pots, which are renowned for their high-fire, waterproof, ultra-strong material.[/woodmart_text_block][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1683803465632{margin-right: -10px !important;margin-left: -10px !important;}" woodmart_css_id="645ccd3c5551e" How can you evaluate content without design? No typography, no colors, no layout, no styles, all those things that convey the important signals that go beyond the mere textual, hierarchies of information, weight, emphasis, oblique stresses, priorities, all those subtle cues that also have visual and emotional appeal to the reader. Rigid proponents of content strategy may shun the use of dummy copy but then designers might want to ask them to provide style sheets with the copy decks they supply that are in tune with the design direction they require.[/woodmart_text_block][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: N’joy Pothos
item.dc:creator: zakhar
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column width="1/2"][woodmart_title align="left" size="large" woodmart_css_id="645ca6c780353" title="Plants" css=".vc_custom_1683793612552{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDVjYTZjNzgwMzUzIiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfdGl0bGUiLCJkYXRhIjp7InRhYmxldCI6e30sIm1vYmlsZSI6e319fQ=="][woodmart_text_block woodmart_css_id="645a0c04b3240" woodmart_inline="no" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDVhMGMwNGIzMjQwIiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfdGV4dF9ibG9jayIsImRhdGEiOnsidGFibGV0Ijp7fSwibW9iaWxlIjp7fX19" parallax_scroll="no" wd_hide_on_desktop="no" wd_hide_on_tablet="no" wd_hide_on_mobile="no"]Croton, also called “garden croton,” are native to the tropical forests of southeast Asia and Oceania. In the wild, they grow as large shrubs, reaching up to 10 feet tall (in the home or garden, they stay a lot smaller). Croton petra plants are susceptible to the bacterial diseases crown gall and xanthomonas leaf spot, and the fungal diseases anthracnose and stem gall and canker. Both crown gall and stem gall and canker present with swelling on the plant's stems, leaf veins and roots and require the pruning of all infected parts in order to be controlled. Xanthomonas leaf spot is identified through the dark brown and black lesions that appear on the leaves. A copper containing bactericide can be used preventatively, but once the plant is infected, it will need to be eliminated. If your plant has anthracnose, you'll notice water spots that turn tan and sometimes have black dots in the center. Note: All parts of this plant are poisonous—especially the seeds—so it is not recommended for use in homes with curious pets or children. When damaged, croton produce a milky sap that can be irritating to the skin, too.[/woodmart_text_block][woodmart_info_box image="235" rounding_size="" image_alignment="left" title_size="large" btn_position="static" btn_color="primary" btn_style="link" woodmart_css_id="6489b6e44b1b4" img_size="103x110" title="Visit the plant care library" btn_text="Care library" svg_animation="no" info_box_inline="no" css=".vc_custom_1686746891645{padding-top: 40px !important;padding-right: 40px !important;padding-bottom: 40px !important;padding-left: 40px !important;background-color: #f6f3ed !important;}" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDg5YjZlNDRiMWI0Iiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfaW5mb19ib3giLCJkYXRhIjp7InRhYmxldCI6e30sIm1vYmlsZSI6e319fQ==" wd_z_index="no" wd_hide_on_desktop="no" wd_hide_on_tablet="no" wd_hide_on_mobile="no" link="url:https%3A%2F%2Fwoodmart.xtemos.com%2Fplants%2Fcare-library%2F|title:Care%20library" woodmart_empty_space=""]Here you will find many useful tips for caring your plants.[/woodmart_info_box][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][woodmart_text_block woodmart_css_id="645a0911b9771" woodmart_inline="no" css=".vc_custom_1683622189660{margin-bottom: 10px !important;}" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDVhMDkxMWI5NzcxIiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfdGV4dF9ibG9jayIsImRhdGEiOnsidGFibGV0Ijp7fSwibW9iaWxlIjp7fX19" parallax_scroll="no" wd_hide_on_desktop="no" wd_hide_on_tablet="no" wd_hide_on_mobile="no"]

How to Care for Croton

[/woodmart_text_block][woodmart_list size="medium" list_type="image" image="28" woodmart_css_id="6489b70f5dbc4" list_items_gap="eyJkZXZpY2VzIjp7ImRlc2t0b3AiOnsidW5pdCI6InB4IiwidmFsdWUiOiIxNSJ9LCJ0YWJsZXQiOnsidW5pdCI6InB4IiwidmFsdWUiOiIwIn0sIm1vYmlsZSI6eyJ1bml0IjoicHgiLCJ2YWx1ZSI6IjAifX19" list="%5B%7B%22list-content%22%3A%22Place%20croton%20in%20a%20sunny%20location%20such%20as%20an%20eastern%2C%20southern%2C%20or%20western%20window.%22%2C%22item_type%22%3A%22inherit%22%7D%2C%7B%22list-content%22%3A%22Keep%20the%20soil%20evenly%20moist%2C%20but%20let%20it%20dry%20out%20between%20waterings.%22%2C%22item_type%22%3A%22inherit%22%7D%2C%7B%22list-content%22%3A%22If%20humidity%20is%20low%20in%20your%20home%2C%20mist%20around%20the%20leaves%20with%20water%20once%20a%20week.%22%2C%22item_type%22%3A%22inherit%22%7D%2C%7B%22list-content%22%3A%22Gently%20wipe%20the%20leaves%20with%20a%20moist%20cloth%20twice%20a%20month%20to%20keep%20them%20clean.%22%2C%22item_type%22%3A%22inherit%22%7D%5D" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDg5YjcwZjVkYmM0Iiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfbGlzdCIsImRhdGEiOnsidGFibGV0Ijp7fSwibW9iaWxlIjp7fX19" img_size="6x6" css=".vc_custom_1686746904814{margin-left: 10px !important;}"][woodmart_image rounding_size="" woodmart_css_id="6489b71a7d3ad" img_id="237" img_size="full" display_inline="no" parallax_scroll="no" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDg5YjcxYTdkM2FkIiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfaW1hZ2UiLCJkYXRhIjp7InRhYmxldCI6e30sIm1vYmlsZSI6e319fQ==" woodmart_box_shadow="no" wd_hide_on_desktop="no" wd_hide_on_tablet="no" wd_hide_on_mobile="no"][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded:
This plant is native to the tropical forests of Southeast Asia and Oceania. For decades, plants in the Croton family were considered outdoor-only, needing several hours of direct light to thrive.
Croton petra plants are susceptible to the bacterial diseases crown gall and xanthomonas leaf spot, and the fungal diseases anthracnose and stem gall and canker...

How to Care for Croton","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_text_block"},{"id":"74f124b","elType":"widget","settings":{"list_items":[{"list_content":"Place croton in a sunny location such as an eastern, southern, or western window.\nwd-furniture-dot-list","_id":"01db63c"},{"list_content":"Keep the soil evenly moist, but let it dry out between waterings.","_id":"b31ab18"},{"list_content":"If humidity is low in your home, mist around the leaves with water once a week.","_id":"0a2e8f7"},{"list_content":"Gently wipe the leaves with a moist cloth twice a month to keep them clean.","_id":"d518e2d"}],"list_type":"image","size":"medium","scroll_y":-80,"image":{"url":"http:\/\/dummy.xtemos.com\/woodmart2\/plants-elementor\/wp-content\/uploads\/sites\/12\/2023\/06\/wd-furniture-dot-list.svg","id":196,"size":"","alt":"","source":"library"},"image_size":"custom","image_custom_dimension":{"width":"6","height":"6"}},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_list"},{"id":"4961dbf","elType":"widget","settings":{"image":{"url":"http:\/\/dummy.xtemos.com\/woodmart2\/plants-elementor\/wp-content\/uploads\/sites\/12\/2023\/06\/w-ps-product-description-opt.jpg","id":200,"size":"","alt":"","source":"library"},"scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_image_or_svg"}],"isInner":false}],"isInner":false}]

In the wild, they grow as large shrubs, reaching up to 10 feet tall (in the home or garden, they stay a lot smaller). Croton petra plants are susceptible to the bacterial diseases crown gall and xanthomonas leaf spot, and the fungal diseases anthracnose and stem gall and canker. Both crown gall and stem gall and canker present with swelling on the plant's stems, leaf veins and roots and require the pruning of all infected parts in order to be controlled. Xanthomonas leaf spot is identified through the dark brown and black lesions that appear on the leaves. A copper containing bactericide can be used preventatively, but once the plant is infected, it will need to be eliminated. If your plant has anthracnose, you'll notice water spots that turn tan and sometimes have black dots in the center. Note: All parts of this plant are poisonous—especially the seeds—so it is not recommended for use in homes with curious pets or children. When damaged, croton produce a milky sap that can be irritating to the skin, too.[/woodmart_text_block][woodmart_info_box image="235" rounding_size="" image_alignment="left" title_size="large" btn_position="static" btn_color="primary" btn_style="link" woodmart_css_id="6489b6e44b1b4" img_size="103x110" title="Visit the plant care library" btn_text="Care library" svg_animation="no" info_box_inline="no" css=".vc_custom_1686746891645{padding-top: 40px !important;padding-right: 40px !important;padding-bottom: 40px !important;padding-left: 40px !important;background-color: #f6f3ed !important;}" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDg5YjZlNDRiMWI0Iiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfaW5mb19ib3giLCJkYXRhIjp7InRhYmxldCI6e30sIm1vYmlsZSI6e319fQ==" wd_z_index="no" wd_hide_on_desktop="no" wd_hide_on_tablet="no" wd_hide_on_mobile="no" link="url:https%3A%2F%2Fwoodmart.xtemos.com%2Fplants%2Fcare-library%2F|title:Care%20library" woodmart_empty_space=""]Here you will find many useful tips for caring your plants.[/woodmart_info_box][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][woodmart_text_block woodmart_css_id="645a0911b9771" woodmart_inline="no" css=".vc_custom_1683622189660{margin-bottom: 10px !important;}" responsive_spacing="eyJwYXJhbV90eXBlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfcmVzcG9uc2l2ZV9zcGFjaW5nIiwic2VsZWN0b3JfaWQiOiI2NDVhMDkxMWI5NzcxIiwic2hvcnRjb2RlIjoid29vZG1hcnRfdGV4dF9ibG9jayIsImRhdGEiOnsidGFibGV0Ijp7fSwibW9iaWxlIjp7fX19" parallax_scroll="no" wd_hide_on_desktop="no" wd_hide_on_tablet="no" wd_hide_on_mobile="no"]

item.excerpt:encoded:
A plant stand makes it possible to decorate with plants everywhere in the home. The pot stand fits both large and small pots. All you need to do is turn the stand over.
Take your plants to new heights. With Svartpeppar plant stand you can put your pots on display and make the area livelier – both indoors and outdoors.

[{"id":"ad61709","elType":"section","settings":{"structure":"20","gap":"extended"},"elements":[{"id":"089fc49","elType":"column","settings":{"_column_size":50,"_inline_size":null,"column_sticky_offset":50,"scroll_y":-80},"elements":[{"id":"589f4e7","elType":"widget","settings":{"subtitle":"","title":"Plants","after_title":"","size":"large","align":"left","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_title"},{"id":"52fca81","elType":"widget","settings":{"text":"

Croton, also called \u201cgarden croton,\u201d are native to the tropical forests of southeast Asia and Oceania. In the wild, they grow as large shrubs, reaching up to 10 feet tall (in the home or garden, they stay a lot smaller).

Croton petra plants are susceptible to the bacterial diseases crown gall and xanthomonas leaf spot, and the fungal diseases anthracnose and stem gall and canker. Both crown gall and stem gall and canker present with swelling on the plant's stems, leaf veins and roots and require the pruning of all infected parts in order to be controlled. Xanthomonas leaf spot is identified through the dark brown and black lesions that appear on the leaves. A copper containing bactericide can be used preventatively, but once the plant is infected, it will need to be eliminated. If your plant has anthracnose, you'll notice water spots that turn tan and sometimes have black dots in the center.

Note: All parts of this plant are poisonous\u2014especially the seeds\u2014so it is not recommended for use in homes with curious pets or children. When damaged, croton produce a milky sap that can be irritating to the skin, too.","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_text_block"},{"id":"73ed8e0","elType":"widget","settings":{"icon_type":"icon","icon_text":"53","image":{"url":"http:\/\/dummy.xtemos.com\/woodmart2\/plants-elementor\/wp-content\/uploads\/sites\/12\/2023\/06\/w-ps-product-care-library.png","id":185,"size":"","alt":"","source":"library"},"image_size":"custom","image_custom_dimension":{"width":"103","height":"110"},"subtitle":"","title":"Visit the plant care library","content":"

item.excerpt:encoded:
A plant stand makes it possible to decorate with plants everywhere in the home. The pot stand fits both large and small pots. All you need to do is turn the stand over.
Take your plants to new heights. With Svartpeppar plant stand you can put your pots on display and make the area livelier – both indoors and outdoors.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
[{"id":"ad61709","elType":"section","settings":{"structure":"20","gap":"extended"},"elements":[{"id":"089fc49","elType":"column","settings":{"_column_size":50,"_inline_size":null,"column_sticky_offset":50,"scroll_y":-80},"elements":[{"id":"589f4e7","elType":"widget","settings":{"subtitle":"","title":"Plants","after_title":"","size":"large","align":"left","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_title"},{"id":"52fca81","elType":"widget","settings":{"text":"

Croton, also called \u201cgarden croton,\u201d are native to the tropical forests of southeast Asia and Oceania. In the wild, they grow as large shrubs, reaching up to 10 feet tall (in the home or garden, they stay a lot smaller).

Croton petra plants are susceptible to the bacterial diseases crown gall and xanthomonas leaf spot, and the fungal diseases anthracnose and stem gall and canker. Both crown gall and stem gall and canker present with swelling on the plant's stems, leaf veins and roots and require the pruning of all infected parts in order to be controlled. Xanthomonas leaf spot is identified through the dark brown and black lesions that appear on the leaves. A copper containing bactericide can be used preventatively, but once the plant is infected, it will need to be eliminated. If your plant has anthracnose, you'll notice water spots that turn tan and sometimes have black dots in the center.

Note: All parts of this plant are poisonous\u2014especially the seeds\u2014so it is not recommended for use in homes with curious pets or children. When damaged, croton produce a milky sap that can be irritating to the skin, too.","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_text_block"},{"id":"73ed8e0","elType":"widget","settings":{"icon_type":"icon","icon_text":"53","image":{"url":"http:\/\/dummy.xtemos.com\/woodmart2\/plants-elementor\/wp-content\/uploads\/sites\/12\/2023\/06\/w-ps-product-care-library.png","id":185,"size":"","alt":"","source":"library"},"image_size":"custom","image_custom_dimension":{"width":"103","height":"110"},"subtitle":"","title":"Visit the plant care library","content":"

How to Care for Croton","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_text_block"},{"id":"74f124b","elType":"widget","settings":{"list_items":[{"list_content":"Place croton in a sunny location such as an eastern, southern, or western window.\nwd-furniture-dot-list","_id":"01db63c"},{"list_content":"Keep the soil evenly moist, but let it dry out between waterings.","_id":"b31ab18"},{"list_content":"If humidity is low in your home, mist around the leaves with water once a week.","_id":"0a2e8f7"},{"list_content":"Gently wipe the leaves with a moist cloth twice a month to keep them clean.","_id":"d518e2d"}],"list_type":"image","size":"medium","scroll_y":-80,"image":{"url":"http:\/\/dummy.xtemos.com\/woodmart2\/plants-elementor\/wp-content\/uploads\/sites\/12\/2023\/06\/wd-furniture-dot-list.svg","id":196,"size":"","alt":"","source":"library"},"image_size":"custom","image_custom_dimension":{"width":"6","height":"6"}},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_list"},{"id":"4961dbf","elType":"widget","settings":{"image":{"url":"http:\/\/dummy.xtemos.com\/woodmart2\/plants-elementor\/wp-content\/uploads\/sites\/12\/2023\/06\/w-ps-product-description-opt.jpg","id":200,"size":"","alt":"","source":"library"},"scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_image_or_svg"}],"isInner":false}],"isInner":false}]

Croton petra plants are susceptible to the bacterial diseases crown gall and xanthomonas leaf spot, and the fungal diseases anthracnose and stem gall and canker. Both crown gall and stem gall and canker present with swelling on the plant's stems, leaf veins and roots and require the pruning of all infected parts in order to be controlled. Xanthomonas leaf spot is identified through the dark brown and black lesions that appear on the leaves. A copper containing bactericide can be used preventatively, but once the plant is infected, it will need to be eliminated. item.excerpt:encoded:
This plant is native to the tropical forests of Southeast Asia and Oceania. For decades, plants in the Croton family were considered outdoor-only, needing several hours of direct light to thrive.
Croton petra plants are susceptible to the bacterial diseases crown gall and xanthomonas leaf spot, and the fungal diseases anthracnose and stem gall and canker...

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
[{"id":"ad61709","elType":"section","settings":{"structure":"20","gap":"extended"},"elements":[{"id":"089fc49","elType":"column","settings":{"_column_size":50,"_inline_size":null,"column_sticky_offset":50,"scroll_y":-80},"elements":[{"id":"589f4e7","elType":"widget","settings":{"subtitle":"","title":"Plants","after_title":"","size":"large","align":"left","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_title"},{"id":"52fca81","elType":"widget","settings":{"text":"

Croton, also called \u201cgarden croton,\u201d are native to the tropical forests of southeast Asia and Oceania. In the wild, they grow as large shrubs, reaching up to 10 feet tall (in the home or garden, they stay a lot smaller).

Croton petra plants are susceptible to the bacterial diseases crown gall and xanthomonas leaf spot, and the fungal diseases anthracnose and stem gall and canker. Both crown gall and stem gall and canker present with swelling on the plant's stems, leaf veins and roots and require the pruning of all infected parts in order to be controlled. Xanthomonas leaf spot is identified through the dark brown and black lesions that appear on the leaves. A copper containing bactericide can be used preventatively, but once the plant is infected, it will need to be eliminated. If your plant has anthracnose, you'll notice water spots that turn tan and sometimes have black dots in the center.

Note: All parts of this plant are poisonous\u2014especially the seeds\u2014so it is not recommended for use in homes with curious pets or children. When damaged, croton produce a milky sap that can be irritating to the skin, too.","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_text_block"},{"id":"73ed8e0","elType":"widget","settings":{"icon_type":"icon","icon_text":"53","image":{"url":"http:\/\/dummy.xtemos.com\/woodmart2\/plants-elementor\/wp-content\/uploads\/sites\/12\/2023\/06\/w-ps-product-care-library.png","id":185,"size":"","alt":"","source":"library"},"image_size":"custom","image_custom_dimension":{"width":"103","height":"110"},"subtitle":"","title":"Visit the plant care library","content":"

How to Care for Croton","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_text_block"},{"id":"74f124b","elType":"widget","settings":{"list_items":[{"list_content":"Place croton in a sunny location such as an eastern, southern, or western window.\nwd-furniture-dot-list","_id":"01db63c"},{"list_content":"Keep the soil evenly moist, but let it dry out between waterings.","_id":"b31ab18"},{"list_content":"If humidity is low in your home, mist around the leaves with water once a week.","_id":"0a2e8f7"},{"list_content":"Gently wipe the leaves with a moist cloth twice a month to keep them clean.","_id":"d518e2d"}],"list_type":"image","size":"medium","scroll_y":-80,"image":{"url":"http:\/\/dummy.xtemos.com\/woodmart2\/plants-elementor\/wp-content\/uploads\/sites\/12\/2023\/06\/wd-furniture-dot-list.svg","id":196,"size":"","alt":"","source":"library"},"image_size":"custom","image_custom_dimension":{"width":"6","height":"6"}},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_list"},{"id":"4961dbf","elType":"widget","settings":{"image":{"url":"http:\/\/dummy.xtemos.com\/woodmart2\/plants-elementor\/wp-content\/uploads\/sites\/12\/2023\/06\/w-ps-product-description-opt.jpg","id":200,"size":"","alt":"","source":"library"},"scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_image_or_svg"}],"isInner":false}],"isInner":false}]

In the wild, they grow as large shrubs, reaching up to 10 feet tall (in the home or garden, they stay a lot smaller). Croton petra plants are susceptible to the bacterial diseases crown gall and xanthomonas leaf spot, and the fungal diseases anthracnose and stem gall and canker. Both crown gall and stem gall and canker present with swelling on the plant's stems, leaf veins and roots and require the pruning of all infected parts in order to be controlled. Xanthomonas leaf spot is identified through the dark brown and black lesions that appear on the leaves. A copper containing bactericide can be used preventatively, but once the plant is infected, it will need to be eliminated. item.excerpt:encoded:
This plant is native to the tropical forests of Southeast Asia and Oceania. For decades, plants in the Croton family were considered outdoor-only, needing several hours of direct light to thrive.
Croton petra plants are susceptible to the bacterial diseases crown gall and xanthomonas leaf spot, and the fungal diseases anthracnose and stem gall and canker...

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
[{"id":"ad61709","elType":"section","settings":{"structure":"20","gap":"extended"},"elements":[{"id":"089fc49","elType":"column","settings":{"_column_size":50,"_inline_size":null,"column_sticky_offset":50,"scroll_y":-80},"elements":[{"id":"589f4e7","elType":"widget","settings":{"subtitle":"","title":"Plants","after_title":"","size":"large","align":"left","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_title"},{"id":"52fca81","elType":"widget","settings":{"text":"

Croton, also called \u201cgarden croton,\u201d are native to the tropical forests of southeast Asia and Oceania. In the wild, they grow as large shrubs, reaching up to 10 feet tall (in the home or garden, they stay a lot smaller).

Croton petra plants are susceptible to the bacterial diseases crown gall and xanthomonas leaf spot, and the fungal diseases anthracnose and stem gall and canker. Both crown gall and stem gall and canker present with swelling on the plant's stems, leaf veins and roots and require the pruning of all infected parts in order to be controlled. Xanthomonas leaf spot is identified through the dark brown and black lesions that appear on the leaves. A copper containing bactericide can be used preventatively, but once the plant is infected, it will need to be eliminated. If your plant has anthracnose, you'll notice water spots that turn tan and sometimes have black dots in the center.

Note: All parts of this plant are poisonous\u2014especially the seeds\u2014so it is not recommended for use in homes with curious pets or children. When damaged, croton produce a milky sap that can be irritating to the skin, too.","scroll_y":-80},"elements":[],"widgetType":"wd_text_block"},{"id":"73ed8e0","elType":"widget","settings":{"icon_type":"icon","icon_text":"53","image":{"url":"http:\/\/dummy.xtemos.com\/woodmart2\/plants-elementor\/wp-content\/uploads\/sites\/12\/2023\/06\/w-ps-product-care-library.png","id":185,"size":"","alt":"","source":"library"},"image_size":"custom","image_custom_dimension":{"width":"103","height":"110"},"subtitle":"","title":"Visit the plant care library","content":"
